title: Structure and acquisition of classifiers and role shift in British Sign Language
abstractText: This project seeks to examine classifier constructions and role shift in British Sign Language and the effect of early versus late language exposure on signer's productions and understanding of these constructions. Classifiers and role shift have traditionally been difficult to characterise linguistically because they share many characteristics with gesture, perhaps more than any other type of construction in the language. By examining these constructions within native signers and early and late learners, both adults and children, we hope to gain more insight into the visual-spatial language modality and also the relationship between sign language and gesture.
